title: BioShock Infinite OST - Definitive Edition V2
description:
This is my Ã¢â‚¬Å“completeÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ rip of BioShock Infinite and its DLCÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s. It contains mostly files directly ripped from the game by me and converted to mp3 for your convenience. I decided to take on this glorious task because of the seeming lack of well-made OST's on the interwebs. I hope you appreciate my effort:

**Changelog** :

- Fixed minor Tagging Mistakes: "Tainted Love" - BioShock Infinite - OST, Burial at Sea Episode Two - OST, changed "accordeon" into accordion as intended.

- Added as requested "La Vie en Rose (Ingame)"

- Fixed "Shiny Happy People", replaced "Goodnight, Irene" with a better version (Previous version is now in Extras folder), Fixed "Everybody Wants to Rule the World", Added "Fortunate Son (Battle) - inspired by Gardimuer" & " 'Our New Found Shoes' " in Extras of BioShock Infinite - OST

- Added as requested "God Only Knows (Extended)"


**Credits** :

BioShock Infinite:

- The Original Soundtrack was not ripped by me nor do I know who did it, so my thanks to you anon.

- Black Gal (Ripped by me from the CD Prison Songs Volume 1)

- Indian Love Call (Which was kindly ripped by a friend of mine from a vinyl) - (Thinking about replacement)

Burial at Sea Episode 1 & 2:

- La Vie en Rose (Intro Audio) by a fellow youtuber who did an awesome job at ripping the game audio. I Ã¢â‚¬Å“borrowedÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ this montage of his because it is kind of cool. Check him out here : [https://www[.]youtube[.]com/channel/UCMTiHQINNKbWUgc7g9YDDow] 

- Also I couldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have recreated the La Vie en Rose (Orchestral Version) without his previous work.

- Covers are also made by him, so all rights go to him as well. I remade the cover for episode 1 because I thought a bigger resolution would look better. I was too lazy to remake the cover for episode 2.

Indexing and tagging courtesy of the BioShock Wikia and its associates. (Thank you Gardimuer [https://www[.]youtube[.]com/user/Gardimuer] and Wikia Staff)

If you have any constructive criticism on the order/tagging and/or the missing songs (if there are any) please make yourself known and I see to it that it will get fixed.
